intro: Fumaria capreolata subsp. babingtonii, commonly known as the Babington's celandine, is a flowering plant belonging to the Papaveraceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shady woodlands and has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, dark seeds. This subspecies is relatively rare and is found primarily in specific regions of Europe.
